page.title: 16MY MUM IS A NIGHT SISTER
page.content: My mum works at Bretby Orthopaedic Hospial near Burton. She leaves home at 19.45 and begins work at 20.15. She works on various wards,tidying beds,taking blood pressures, temperatures and pulses,filling in the bed state,dealing with bedpans and also doing office work. Sometimes she is completely in charge of a ward. Bretby hospital has 84 beds. It deals with knee or hip replacement,joint surgery, foot and cartilage operations and convalescence.There is a special air filter round the operating table which ensures that the air is sterile. The doctors and nurses have to wear special suits-they look like space suits-cutting out any risk of breathing germs over the patients. There are Physio and Occupational Therapy departments. Interview by Samantha Jackson.
